intro: Tanarius heudelotii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Tanarius heudelotii prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
